name: Journey of a Roach
description: Nuclear war, post apocalypse, barren and lifeless wastelands.Lifeless? Not so much!Mutated insects have made their home in a bomb shelter and they're set on exploring the world.Let this point&click adventure welcome you to a hilariously bizarre end time world and join the roaches Jim and Bud on their journey to the surface.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista/7 Processor: 2.5 GHz (Single Core) or better Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible with 256 MB RAM (shared memory not recommended) DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2500 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible sound card and drivers Additional Notes: Keyboard, Mouse
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8 Processor: 2.5 GHz (Single Core) or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible with 512 MB RAM (shared memory not recommended) DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2500 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible sound card and drivers Additional Notes: Keyboard, Mouse, Microsoft XBox Controller

reviews.review_text: Journey of a roach has a good story and interesting puzzles from the beginning to the end. Also it has lovable characters and nice songs. It is a short game and you will finish it in a few hours but it worth it. It has cool achievements to unlock and this will double the playing time.

I cant believe it. A journey of a roach that is so interesting and likeable. Sure its Daedalic that publish it and even when it has not the jokes of Deponia, it has its own unique funny style, cute little riddles, gimmicks to find like worms, cakes that aren´t a lie (Portal), makeable speedrun where you can test you skills or a challenge like the Rock movie (Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage) dont get hit from the fire ventilators). For me it makes fun, its short but the quality is nice, at the moment you can see a happy birthday version till 30 november. Take a look, give it a chance and hopefully enjoy it. Thanks for reading. Have a happy day. I give this game personal 82% (only because the game lenght i cant get enough from the gameplay so i hope you support the game and maybe we get a 2nd part in some years). Bye

very good little game,some say its short,well it is, but that contains no negative meaning, just like i say a miniskirt, is it bad? not at all. some smart object combinations gives you 'wow', may need to refer to a walkthrough at some point, but quite fun, get it on sale or trade it with your bundle game, i can say it worth my time.

This game is really fun and interesting. It is casual and relax to play. Some puzzles are somewhat hard to solve but most of them are easy to get through. It is not a hard game at all, just a tip for those who want to play a difficult puzzle game. But still, I highly recommend this game since I had a really good time playing it.

I did not think I would enjoy game with roaches that much but this game surprised me. The idea was fun and story was entertaining and humorous. Puzzles were good and I really enjoyed walking on walls. Only downside was that this game was really short, I would have gladly played more of this strange adventure!

This is a nice little adventure game, I enjoyed it. There is no real talking, just cartoon balloons to describe the puzzles, a bit like the game violet. The cutscenes are drawings, so no movies. As a cockroach you are not limited to the floor so you can walk on walls and ceilings which makes the camera rotate with you. Puzzles are not so difficult. Achievements are easy, there are 3 difficult ones, playing the game under 18 minutes is hard to master.  When it's on sale for not much money, I recommend to buy it.

Developed by: Koboldgames, Daedalic Entertainment Published by:Daedalic Entertainment Release Date: November 4, 2013  + Pros:  ▲ Visuals ▲ Gameplay ▲ Soundtrack ▲ Story ▲ Achievements ▲ Cards  10 / 10 - Never thought that being a roach is such an awesome experience.
Ridiculously cute game, very well done.
A supprisingly good adventure game.
15 Dollar is too much for such a short game, if u dont got it from Humble Bundle dont buy it
Fell asleep while playing now it looks like I love this game to ♥♥♥♥, I do not.
Funny and original point-&-click adventure, with its own identity, recommended!
A charming game but very short and has some frustrating puzzle solutions.
Yea... No. I like puzzle games. I don't like this. Seriously, a net can't catch a fly? How else am I meant to catch it then?!
It has a good story and fun gameplay.
WASD point and click well made.  There is sound bugs where music stops and starts in 1 location
Not recommended if it is not -90% price. Content is very very short... ...
Relaxing game to burn a couple hours on. Better than 95% of COD games.

I finished the game so I guess I should recommend it. But it's not very good and definitely not worth full price.   Controls are clumsy and the puzzles are either easy or obtuse. The story is fairly good though.
Made it trough the game in less than three hours... But really had fun in those :)  Good story and nice graphics.  Still glad i didn't buy it for full price, 14.99 Euros would have been a bit much.

It's fun and cute. And a little bit macabre.   You play as a roach in a post-nuclear world. As a roach, you can walk up/down walls or even across the ceiling, which makes for interesting navigation puzzles. The difficulty was right for me - puzzles are based on routing power to the proper place, navigating around or moving obstacles, and interacting with friendly and not-so-friendly fellow insects. The plot is fairly simple, and told through nonsense mutters and picto-grams so that subtitles/voice-overs are not an issue.   In short, recommended especially when it [frequently] goes on sale. Just don't expect anything deep. It took me just over 2 hours to complete, working on the achievements now.

This game is cute and fun! It doesn't last long, maybe 5 hours tops. I experienced a couple minor glitches, and occasionally the game lagged a bit, although the latter is probably just due to my computer. The controls can be a little wonky, but nothing too annoying.  I definitely don't think it's worth anywhere near it's full price; however, if you're looking for a unique point & click/puzzle game, and it's on sale, you should try it!

This game is a very unique masterpiece. It is a short game, but I enjoyed every second of it. It is a great idea, that the main character can crawl along the walls and the camera rotates with him and suddenly you see everything upside down. I recommend you to buy it if you want a very nice and unique adventure game!!!

Being able to play as a roach is enough of an argument to buy the game.  + funny + original + smart gameplay with the possibility to walk on walls and ceilings + possibility to zoom out and see all the interactive items in the area + no text, hints are drawn  - short - hints are not always clear - it's not always obvious which wall you can/can't walk on
I LOVE this game, though it can be tough.

comic anf funny atmosphere, moderate puzzles and nice, funny game. Only problem; game is realy realy short. After credits i feel alittle bit sad, was expecting much more, maybe 4x. I say if you can find it under 5$ with daily, weekly sales etc, dont hesitate. But 15$ alittle bit too much for 1-4 hours gameplay.
Great graphics, sound, humor, puzzles. But too short. The new puzzle mechanics are so fun!
Fun narrative, nice graphics...

Eh  Journey of a Roach is a point and click adventure game where you are a roach (duh) that needs to find his friend and look for a flower. The story is pretty original but isn't fully fleshed out because the game is so short. The art style of the game is fantastic and the music is great as it fits the areas and rooms well.   However, the puzzles are frustrating as you wouldn't really think of the solutions naturally. You have a do a specific thing in a specific way which I wouldn't have normally done. Additionally, the puzzle pieces are easy to miss and it is hard to tell what is what.  Overall, the art was good and the story was alright. However, the lack of logical puzzles and obscure solutions kind of ruin it for me.
NIce game,  follow the adventures of a Roach and his mate, solving puzzles to advance. Walking on walls is always great.
This was a fun game to play , although I think it's a bit overpriced for a 2 hour playthrough. But I bought it for 74 cents so it was great for me.

well have enjoyed my 2 hours but at this point I am done with the game I am at a poit that I can no go any further due poor Puzzle lay out, I read how easy they are like no big deal and I call BS, I love a good puzzle game but this lay out is very poor and the puzzles them self make no sense, so if you like walking in circle then this is the game for you, Most of the puzzle pieces you get you have no idea what they are in order to be able to use them so all you do is click, click, click till something will work but that is as good as it gets, and no hints and no hope the point that I am stuck at I have no more puzzle piece to collect much less even be able to use and I am just stuck in the same 3 rooms so now over an hour stuck in the same spot I say good day to this game damn shame being I did like it but don't care to waste a life time much less another hour stuck for nothing, well I go the game for cheap so no loss, just another cobb web collect game now, unistalled and on to other games just can't see wasting any more time on this poor lay out for a puzzle game but great concept, good luck, have fun then beat your head in the wall and ask why did I even go down this road with this game. I only recommend if you can get it cheap being you will waste money but it is different to see so I guess that makes up for it.

Never did I think I would ever find any enjoyment looking at roaches, other than at someone elses expense I suppose, but I rather enjoyed this game for what it is. It has a comical, or cute, art style. Fun and interesting crawling (almost) anywhere, up and down walls, and on ceilings. Puzzles are not hard (kind of the point with this type of game), if not obvious, though enjoyable.   If you want something short (can be a positive sometimes, atleast for me), lighthearted, and that should give you a chuckle or two, then I recommend this game.  I wouldn't pay $15 for it though, too short, get it on sale. Not counting it being short, or if you play through it more than once for achievements, it might be worth that price point; even more so if it was more like $10. But yeah, get it on sale, most definitely worth it for $5 or less.
A solid and fun adventure game that's worth a playthrough. I enjoyed the time I spent with this one.
